thread.title: Andre Johnson burns Texans in return to Houston
thread.title_full: Andre Johnson burns Texans in return to Houston

title: Andre Johnson burns Texans in return to Houston
text:
Andre Johnson burns Texans in return to Houston Associated Press The Colts' Andre Johnson (81) celebrates with teammate Matt Hasselbeck after they connected on a touchdown pass during the second half. By Associated Press (0) Comments 
Houston — Andre Johnson proved to his former team that he still has plenty left. 
Johnson caught two touchdown passes from Matt Hasselbeck to help the Indianapolis Colts beat the Houston Texans, 27-20, Thursday night. 
Released by Houston in March after 12 seasons with the team, Johnson had six catches for 77 yards. 
The Colts (3-2) extended their AFC South winning streak to an NFL-record 16 games. 
Brian Hoyer, who replaced Ryan Mallett for Houston (1-4) in the second quarter, threw a pass up for grabs that was intercepted by Mike Adams with less than 2 minutes left. 
Hasselbeck was filling in for Andrew Luck, who missed his second game with a shoulder injury. Hasselbeck may not have been 100%, either, after missing practice Tuesday with an illness. 
DeAndre Hopkins had 11 receptions for 169 yards for Houston. © 2015 , Journal Sentinel Inc. All rights reserved.
